title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEM FOR CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: Al 2025, las autoridades nacionales y provinciales mejoran sus capacidades para generar polÃ­ticas y programas basados en evidencia destinados a universalizar el sistema de protecciÃ³n social para la niÃ±ez y la adolescencia en situaciÃ³n de pobreza y vulnerabilidad. , which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Al 2025, las niÃ±as, niÃ±os y adolescentes que viven en condiciÃ³n de pobreza multidimensional se beneficiarÃ¡n de un sistema de protecciÃ³n social y de un modelo de incentivos municipales y provinciales orientados a reducir la pobreza y garantizar integral y equitativamente sus derechos.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Al 2025, las autoridades nacionales y provinciales mejoran sus capacidades para generar politicas y programas basados en evidenciadestinados a universalizar el sistema de proteccion social para la ni?ez y la adolescencia en situacion de pobreza y vulnerabilidad.

description.narrative: Evidence and knowledge generation on child poverty and social protection, alongside high-level advocacy, continued as a key strategy in the 2021-2025 CP to inform decision making and contribute to expand the social protection system. UNICEF resumed the support to field strategies to include extremely disadvantaged children in AUH after COVID-19 lockdowns, adding 4,489 children. Implementation challenges remain regarding the inclusion of1M children without any coverage, and UNICEF’s public policy recommendations and advocacy efforts continue to inform this process. In 2021 collaboration with grassroot CSOs continued, providing food support to 58,148 children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/01/2022
